listitem.simpara: a mateprint.Config.
a new mateprint.Context.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.newpath

listitem.simpara: a mateprint.Config.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The newpath() method resets currentpath to empty path. As currentpoint is defined as the last point of open path segment, is also erases currentpoint.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.moveto

listitem.simpara: X position in user coordinates.
Y position in user coordinates.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The moveto() method starts new subpath in currentpath with coordinates x,y. Moves currentpoint to x,y.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.lineto

listitem.simpara: X position in user coordinates.
Y position in user coordinates.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The moveto() method adds new straight line segment from currentpoint to x,y to currentpath. Moves currentpoint to x,y. If currentpoint is not defined, returns MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPOINT.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.curveto

listitem.simpara: X position of first control point in user coordinates.
Y position of first control point in user coordinates.
X position of second control point in user coordinates.
Y position of second control point in user coordinates.
X position of third control point in user coordinates.
Y position of third control point in user coordinates.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The curveto() method adds new cubig bezier segment with control points x1,y1 and x2,y2 and endpoint x3,y3 to currentpath. Moves currentpoint to x3,y3. If currentpoint is not defined, returns MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPOINT.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.closepath

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The closepath() method closes the last segment of currentpath, optionally drawing straight line segment from its endpoint to starting point. Erases currentpoint. If currentpath is empty, returns MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.strokepath

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The strokepath() method converts currentpath to new path, that is identical to area painted by mate_print_stroke function, using currentpath. I.e. strokepath followed by fill giver result identical to stroke. If currentpath is empty, returns MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH. Stroked path is always closed, so currentpoint is erased.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.bpath

listitem.simpara: a list of ArtBpath segments
whether to append to currentpath
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The bpath() method adds all bpath segments up to ART_END to currentpath. If append is false, currentpath is cleared first, otherwise segments are appended to existing path. This is identical to adding all segments by hand, so the final state of currentpoint depends on segments processed.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.vpath

listitem.simpara: a list of ArtVpath segments
whether to append to currentpath
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The vpath() method adds all vpath line segments up to ART_END to currentpath. If append is false, currentpath is cleared first, otherwise segments are appended to existing path. This is identical to adding all segments by hand, so the final state of currentpoint depends on segments processed.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.arcto

listitem.simpara: X position of control point in user coordinates.
Y position of control point in user coordinates.
the radius of the arc.
start angle in degrees.
end angle in degrees.
direction of movement, 0 counterclockwise 1 clockwise.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The arcto() method adds an arc with control points x and y with a radius radius and from angle1 to andgle2 in degrees. direction 1 is clockwise 0 counterclockwise

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setrgbcolor

listitem.simpara: Red channel value.
Green channel value.
Blue channel value.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setrgbcolor() method sets color in graphic state to RGB triplet. This does not imply anything about which colorspace is used internally. Channel values are clamped to 0.0 - 1.0 region, 0.0 meaning minimum.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setopacity

listitem.simpara: opacity value.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setopacity() method sets painting opacity in graphic state to given value. Value is clamped to 0.0 - 1.0 region, 0.0 meaning full transparency and 1.0 completely opaque paint.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setlinewidth

listitem.simpara: line width in user coordinates.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setlinewidth() method sets line width in graphic state to given value. Value is given in user coordinates, so effective line width depends on CTM at the moment of stroke or strokepath. Line width is always uniform in all directions, regardless of stretch factor of CTM. Default line width is 1.0 in user coordinates.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setmiterlimit

listitem.simpara: miter limit in degrees.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setmiterlimit() method sets minimum angle between two lines, in which case miter join is used. For smaller angles, join is beveled. Default miter limit is 4 degrees.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setlinejoin

listitem.simpara: integer indicating join type.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setlinejoin() method sets join type for non-colinear line segments. 0 - miter 1 - round 2 - bevel Default join type is miter.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setlinecap

listitem.simpara: integer indicating cap type.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setlinecap() method sets cap type for line endpoints. 0 - butt 1 - round 2 - square Default cap type is butt.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setdash

listitem.simpara: number of dash segment lengths.
nrray of dash segment lengths.
line starting offset in dash.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setdash() method sets line dashing to given pattern. If n_dash is odd, the result is, as if actual number of segments is 2 times bigger, and 2 copies of dash arrays concatenated. If n_values is 0, line is set solid. Dash segment lengths are given in user coordinates, so the actual dash lengths depend on CTM at the time of stroke or strokepath. Dashing is always uniform in all directions, regardless of the stretching factor of CTM. Default is solid line.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.setfont

listitem.simpara: MateFont to use for text.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The setfont() method sets font in graphic state. Font is referenced by mate print, so caller may discard it immediately afterwards. Default font is system dependent.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.clip

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The clip() method defines drawing region as inside area of currentpath. If path is self-intersecting or consists of several overlapping subpaths, nonzero rule is used to define the inside orea of path. All open subpaths of currentpath are closed. If currentpath is empty, MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH is returned. Currentpath is emptied by this function.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.eoclip

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The erclip() method defines drawing region as inside area of currentpath. If path is self-intersecting or consists of several overlapping subpaths, even-odd rule is used to define the inside area of path. All open subpaths of currentpath are closed. If currentpath is empty, MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH is returned. Currentpath is emptied by this function.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.concat

listitem.simpara: 3x2 affine transformation matrix.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The concat() method appends matrix to current transformation matrix (CTM). The resulting transformation from user coordinates to page coordinates is, as if coordinates would first be transformed by matrix, and the results by CTM. Matrix is given in column order, i.e. X' = X * m[0] + Y * m[2] + m[4] Y' = X * m[1] + Y * m[3] + m[5]

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.scale

listitem.simpara: X scale.
Y scale.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The scale() method scales user coordinate system by given X and Y values.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.rotate

listitem.simpara: angle in degrees.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The scale() method rotates user coordinate system theta degrees counterclockwise.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.translate

listitem.simpara: new starting X.
new starting Y.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The translate() method move the starting point of user coordinate system to given point.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.gsave

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The gsave() method saves current graphic state (transformation, color, line properties, font) into stack (push). Values itself remain unchanged. You can later restore saved values, using grestore, but not over page boundaries. Graphic state stack has to be cleared for each showpage, i.e. the number of gsave has to match the number of grestore for each page.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.grestore

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The grestore() method retrieves last saved graphic state from stack (pop). Stack has to be at least the size of one.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.fill

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The fill() method fills the inside area of currentpath, using current graphic state. If path is self-intersecting or consists of several overlapping subpaths, nonzero rule is used to define the inside area of path. All open subpaths of currentpath are closed. If currentpath is empty, MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH is returned. Currentpath is emptied by this function.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.eofill

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The eofill() method fills the inside area of currentpath, using current graphic state. If path is self-intersecting or consists of several overlapping subpaths, even-odd rule is used to define the inside area of path. All open subpaths of currentpath are closed. If currentpath is empty, MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH is returned. Currentpath is emptied by this function.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.stroke

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The stroke() method strokes currentpath, i.e. draws line along it, with style, defined by current graphic state values. If currentpath is empty, MATE_PRINT_ERROR_NOCURRENTPATH is returned. Currentpath is emptied by this function.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.show

listitem.simpara: Null-terminated UTF-8 string.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The show() method draws UTF-8 text at currentpoint, using current font from graphic state. Input text is validated, and MATE_PRINT_ERROR_BADVALUE returned, if it is not valid UTF-8. Both currentpath and currentpoint are erased.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.show_sized

listitem.simpara: UTF-8 text string.
number of bytes to use from string.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The show_sized() method draws UTF-8 text at currentpoint, using current font from graphic state. Input text is validated, and MATE_PRINT_ERROR_BADVALUE returned, if it is not valid UTF-8. Both currentpath and currentpoint are erased.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.glyphlist

listitem.simpara: MateGlyphList text object.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The glyphlist() method draws text, using MateGlyphList rich text format. Glyphlist is rendered in user coordinates, starting from currentpoint. Both currentpath and currentpoint are erased.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.grayimage

listitem.simpara: pointer to image pixel buffer.
image buffer width.
image buffer height.
image buffer rowstride.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The grayimage() method draws grayscale image into unit square (0,0 - 1,1) in current coordinate system. Image buffer has to be 1 byte per pixel, with value 255 marking white and 0 black.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.rgbimage

listitem.simpara: pointer to image pixel buffer.
image buffer width.
image buffer height.
image buffer rowstride.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The rgbimage() method draws RGB color image into unit square (0,0 - 1,1) in current coordinate system. Image buffer has to be 3 bytes per pixel, order RGB, with value 255 marking maximum and 0 minimum value.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.rgbaimage

listitem.simpara: pointer to image pixel buffer.
image buffer width.
image buffer height.
image buffer rowstride.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The rgbaimage() method draws RGB color image with transparency channel image into unit square (0,0 - 1,1) in current coordinate system. Image buffer has to be 4 bytes per pixel, order RGBA, with value 255 marking maximum and 0 minimum value. Alpha value 255 means full opacity, 0 full transparency.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.beginpage

listitem.simpara: name of the page, NULL if you just want to use the page number of the page.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The glyphlist() method starts new output page with name. Naming is used for interactive contexts like MatePrintPreview and Document Structuring Convention conformant PostScript output. This function has to be called before any drawing methods and immediately after each showpage albeit the last one. It also resets graphic state values (transformation, color, line properties, font), so one has to define these again at the beginning of each page.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.showpage

listitem.simpara: MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The showpage() method finishes rendering of current page, and marks it as shown. All subsequent drawing methods will fail, until new page is started with newpage. Printing contexts may process drawing methods differently - some do rendering immediately (like MatePrintPreview), some accumulate all operators to internal stack, and only after showpage is any output produced.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.line_stroked

listitem.simpara: X position of start point in user coordinates.
Y position of start point in user coordinates.
X position of end point in user coordinates.
Y position of end point in user coordinates.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The line_stroked() method is a convenience function to draw a line. Uses stroke to do the actual work.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.rect_stroked

listitem.simpara: X position of origin of rectangle in user coordinates.
Y position of origin of rectangle in user coordinates.
width of the rectangle.
height of the rectangle.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The rect_stroked() method is a convenience function to draw a rectangle. Uses stroke to do the actual work.

refsect2.title: mateprint.Context.rect_filled

listitem.simpara: X position of origin of rectangle in user coordinates.
Y position of origin of rectangle in user coordinates.
width of the rectangle.
height of the rectangle.
MATE_PRINT_OK or positive value on success, negative error code on failure.

refsect2.para: The rect_filled() method is a convenience function to draw a filled rectangle. Uses stroke to do the actual work.
